dmv.spring.demo.model.repository.jdbc

Class CredentialsRepositoryJDBC

  • java.lang.Object
    • dmv.spring.demo.model.repository.jdbc.CredentialsRepositoryJDBC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CredentialsRepository

    @Repository
 @Transactional
public class CredentialsRepositoryJDBC
extends Object
implements CredentialsRepository
    JDBC implementation of CredentialsRepository interface.

    All methods run within transactions.

    Author:
    dmv

    • Method Detail

      • getCredentials

        public User getCredentials(String email)
        Description copied from interface: CredentialsRepository
        Find user by email address and return all details, including password. This is for authentication purposes.
        Specified by:
        getCredentials in interface CredentialsRepository
        Parameters:
        email - User's identifier, unique email address
        Returns:
        User with password field

      • changePassword

        public void changePassword(User user,
                           String newPassword)
        Description copied from interface: CredentialsRepository
        Change existing user's password with the new one. Provided User object must contain correct existing password, it will be checked first. This method returns nothing on success or throws an exception on failure.

        This method won't generate new password in case if given is null or empty - the exception will be thrown instead.

        Specified by:
        changePassword in interface CredentialsRepository
        Parameters:
        user - User with existing password
        newPassword - A new password to be set

      • changeEmail

        public void changeEmail(User user,
                        String newEmail)
        Description copied from interface: CredentialsRepository
        Change existing user's email address. New email address supposed to be unique. This method returns nothing on success or throws an exception on failure.
        Specified by:
        changeEmail in interface CredentialsRepository
        Parameters:
        user - Existing user
        newEmail - New email address
